channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghan refugee heading to UK gives birth at 30,000 feet
item.description: Soman Noori gives birth to baby girl Havva while flying to Birmingham, with no doctor on board.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Second man arrested in Manchester City footballer rape inquiry
item.description: A man, 40, is arrested on suspicion of rape at an address in Cheshire, police say.

item.title: Leamington Spa fire: Fallen debris warning at industrial site
item.description: One employee remains missing following the huge blaze at a plastics manufacturer in Warwickshire.

item.title: 'The Taliban killed my brother for protecting my family'
item.description: Saba says his family have gone into hiding after the Taliban threatened to kill his nephews.

item.title: Kettering: Bodies found after concern for welfare call to police
item.description: Police are working "at pace to establish what has happened" after the pair are found dead.

item.title: Manchester Pride: Protest held over festival management
item.description: Organisers say they will review activities following concerns about the event's management.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine passports 'to boost illegal outdoor raves'
item.description: An organiser of the events says Covid jab scepticism will draw people to so-called "free parties".

item.title: No. 2 to Kettering: School bus memory inspires Disney film
item.description: Liza Rhea says a smile from a stranger when she was a child had a profound effect on her.

item.title: UK's oldest living heart transplant patient marks 90th birthday
item.description: Ted Warner was only expected to live for eight more years after his operation in 1990.

item.title: Westminster double murder: Man, 49, arrested
item.description: Sharon Pickles and Clinton Ashmore were both fatally stabbed in north-west London

item.title: Liverpool man in Afghanistan rescue bid says no escape now
item.description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to Afghanistan 10 days ago to rescue his wife and children.

item.title: Missing Lancaster girl, two, abducted and flown to Spain
item.description: Police believe two-year-old Gracie-May boarded a plane at Glasgow Airport with her parents.

item.title: The tragedy that saw the birth of the Peak District mountain rescue teams
item.description: The deaths of three teenage Scouts in 1964 brought about an expert rescue organisation.

item.title: 'Superstar' dog retires after six years of donating rare blood
item.description: Woodie the greyhound has given blood 22 times to help up to 88 other dogs.

item.title: Afghanistan events 'raw and emotional' for veterans
item.description: Military veteran Nick Wilson says the current Afghanistan crisis is affecting those who fought there.

item.title: Manchester Pride exhibition to reveal stories of freedom
item.description: The audio recordings and portraits form part of a weekend of cultural events to celebrate Pride.

item.title: Drone footage reveals scale of Leamington Spa fire
item.description: Flame and thick, dark smoke fills the sky above Leamington Spa.

item.title: Devon stroke victim inspired to get back on his feet
item.description: Chas Connal was inspired to walk again thanks to a bright idea from his stepdaughter.

item.title: 'It's just nice to feel welcome somewhere'
item.description: Children with missing limbs meet up in South Yorkshire to speak to others like them.

item.title: Convicted gang member bragged about wealth in music videos
item.description: Akeem Chand, 27, rapped about the money he was making through illicit activities.

item.title: Compost: Why are more people dealing with green waste at home?
item.description: The number of people making "black gold" at home surges after some garden waste collections stopped.

item.title: Fulham solicitor accused of injecting blood into stores' food
item.description: The solicitor appeared in court accused of injecting blood into food at three west London stores.

item.title: Bury pub landlord catches Lee Rigby collection box thief
item.description: Stewart Spensley, who served with Lee Rigby, chased the thief when the box was taken from his bar.

item.title: Paul Taylor's rude name place tour suffers hitch after Twatt
item.description: Paul Taylor had ridden 1,200 miles before breaking down on a remote mountain pass in Aberdeenshire.

item.title: Napier Barracks asylum seeker site 'can continue for five years'
item.description: The Home Office had previously not confirmed plans for Napier Barracks in Kent beyond next month.

item.title: England v India: Ollie Robinson takes 5-65 to seal huge Headingley win
item.description: England break India's resistance to surge to victory by an innings and 76 runs in the third Test at Headingley and level the series at 1-1.

item.title: Liverpool 1-1 Chelsea: Mohamed Salah penalty equalises Kai Havertz header at Anfield
item.description: Mohamed Salah scores a penalty to equalise against 10-man Chelsea as Liverpool come from behind to earn a draw at Anfield.

item.title: Manchester City 5-0 Arsenal: Gunners suffer third league defeat in a row
item.description: Arsenal's miserable start to the new Premier League campaign continues as the Gunners are beaten 5-0 by Manchester City.

item.title: Peterborough United 0-1 West Bromwich Albion: Semi Ajayi gets late winner for Baggies
item.description: Semi Ajayi's last-gasp goal sees West Brom snatch a fourth consecutive Championship win and break the hearts of a dogged Peterborough.

item.title: Norwich remain pointless as Albrighton hits Leicester winner
item.description: A rare Marc Albrighton goal and a disallowed Kenny McLean equaliser result in a Leicester a win that leaves Norwich without a point.
